transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, jeeva. welcome to the interview for the frontend developer role. how are you today?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. im doing well, thank you. happy to be here.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: before we start, i want to explain how this interview will go. well focus mainly on frontend technologies such as javascript, html, css, and modern ui frameworks. lets begin with your background. can you tell me about your experience as a frontend developer?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: sure. i have around two and a half years of experience working as a frontend developer. i mostly work with javascript, html, css, and basic react to build user interfaces.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats good. lets start with javascript fundamentals. can you explain what a closure is?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: a closure is when an inner function can access variables from an outer function even after the outer function has finished executing.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good explanation. can you give a simple example of where closures are useful?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: closures are useful in callbacks and event handlers, but i havent used them extensively.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats fine. lets move to ui layout. can you explain the difference between flexbox and grid?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: flexbox is used for one-dimensional layouts, and grid is used for two-dimensional layouts.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good. how do you make a webpage responsive across different screen sizes?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i usually use media queries and responsive units like percentages and rem.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked with any frontend frameworks?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: yes, i have worked with react for building components and handling basic state.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain how state works in react?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: state is used to manage data inside a component, and we can update it using hooks like usestate.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you worked on performance optimization on the frontend, such as reducing re-renders?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have basic knowledge, but i havent done deep performance optimization.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: okay. have you worked closely with backend systems or databases?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no, my role is mostly limited to frontend development. i usually consume apis provided by backend teams.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: understood. just to confirm, do you write sql queries or work directly with databases in your role?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no, i dont work with databases or sql.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: alright. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions. thank you for the interview.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, jeeva. it was nice speaking with you. well get back to you regarding the next steps.
